46   | 
47   | /** not applicable **/
48   | 
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | 
53   | #define WHATIS_SOME	0
54   | #define WHATIS_ALL	1
55   | 
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | /**				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | 
60   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | static	int	 whatis_dir( char*, int, char**, int);
67   | 
68   | /*++++
69   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
70   |  **									     **
71   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Whatis				     **
72   |  **									     **
73   |  **   Description:	Display the passed modules 'whatis' information	     **
74   |  **									     **
75   |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/31					     **
76   |  **									     **
77   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
78   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
79   |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
80   |  **									     **
81   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
82   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
83   |  **									     **
84   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
85   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
86   |  **					control everything		     **
87   |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
88   |  **						by the current command	     **
89   |  **									     **
90   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
91   |  ++++*/
92   | 
93   | int ModuleCmd_Whatis(
94   | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
95   | 	int argc,
96   | 	char *argv[]
97   | ) {
98   | 	Tcl_Interp     *whatis_interp;
99   | 	Tcl_DString     cmdbuf;			/** dynamic string buffer    **/
100  | 	int             i,			/** loop index		     **/
101  | 	                result = TCL_OK;	/** result (default OK	     **/
102  | 	char            modulefile[MOD_BUFSIZE],/** buffer for modulefile    **/
103  | 	                modulename[MOD_BUFSIZE],/** buffer for modulename    **/
104  | 	              **wptr,		/** whatis text line		     **/
105  | 	              **dirname;	/** modulepath dir		     **/
106  | 	uvec           *modpath;	/** MODULEPATH vector list           **/
107  |     /**
108  |      **	 Initialize the command buffer and set up the modules flag to
109  |      **	 'whatisonly'
110  |      **/
111  | 	Tcl_DStringInit(&cmdbuf);
112  | 	g_flags |= M_WHATIS;
113  | 
114  |     /**
115  |      **	 Handle each passed module file. Create a Tcl interpreter for each
116  |      **	 module file to be handled and initialize it with custom module commands
117  |      **/
118  | 
119  | 	if (argc) {
120  |     /**
121  |      **	 User provided a list of modules for ``whatis'' info
122  |      **/
123  | 		for (i = 0; i < argc && argv[i]; i++) {
124  | 			whatis_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
125  | 			if (TCL_OK != (result = Module_Init(whatis_interp))) {
126  | 				Tcl_DeleteInterp(whatis_interp);
127  | 				result = TCL_ERROR;
128  | 				break;
129  | 			}
130  | 	    /**
131  | 	     **	 locate the filename related to the passed module
132  | 	     **/
133  | 			if (TCL_ERROR ==
134  | 			    Locate_ModuleFile(whatis_interp, argv[i],
135  | 					      modulename, modulefile)) {
136  | 				Tcl_DeleteInterp(whatis_interp);
137  | 				if (OK !=
138  | 				    ErrorLogger(ERR_LOCATE, LOC, argv[i], NULL))
139  | 					break;
140  | 				else
141  | 					continue;
142  | 			}
143  | 	    /**
144  | 	     **	 Print out everything that would happen if the module file were
145  | 	     **	 executed ...
146  | 	     **/
147  | 			g_current_module = modulename;
148  | 
149  | 			cmdModuleWhatisInit();
150  | 			result = CallModuleProcedure(whatis_interp, &cmdbuf,
151  | 						     modulefile,
152  | 						     "ModulesWhatis", 0);
153  | 	    /**
154  | 	     **	 Print the result ...
155  | 	     **/
156  | 			if (whatis) {
157  | 				wptr = whatis;
158  | 				while (*wptr)
159  | 					fprintf(stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", argv[i],
160  | 						*wptr++);
161  | 			}
162  | 	    /**
163  | 	     **	 Remove the Tcl interpreter that has been used for printing ...
164  | 	     **/
165  | 			Tcl_DeleteInterp(whatis_interp);
166  | 			cmdModuleWhatisShut();
167  | 		}
168  | 	  /** for **/
169  | 	} else {
170  |        /**
171  | 	**  User wants all module ``whatis'' info
172  | 	**/
173  | 	/**
174  | 	 **  Load the MODULEPATH and split it into a list of paths.
175  | 	 **  Assume success if no list is to be displayed ...
176  | 	 **/
177  | 		if (!(modpath = ModulePathList()))
178  | 			goto unwind0;
179  | 		if (!uvec_number(modpath))
180  | 			goto success0;
181  | 	/**
182  | 	 **  Scan all the files
183  | 	 **/
184  | 		dirname = uvec_vector(modpath);
185  | 		while (dirname && *dirname) {
186  | 			if (!check_dir(*dirname))
187  | 				continue;
188  | 			whatis_dir(*dirname, argc, argv, WHATIS_ALL);
189  | 			dirname++;
190  | 		}
191  | 		FreeList(&modpath);
192  | 	}
193  |     /**
194  |      **	 Leave the 'whatis only mode', free up what has been used and return
195  |      **/
196  | 	g_flags &= ~M_WHATIS;
197  | 	fprintf(stderr, "\n");
198  | 
199  | 	Tcl_DStringFree(&cmdbuf);
200  |     /**
201  |      **	 Return on success
202  |      **/
203  | 
204  | success0:
205  | 	return (result);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (result)  --> **/
206  | 
207  | unwind0:
208  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
209  | 
210  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Whatis' **/
211  | 
212  | /*++++
213  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
214  |  **									     **
215  |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Apropos				     **
216  |  **									     **
217  |  **   Description:	Scan the whatis database in order to find something  **
218  |  **			matching the passed strings			     **
219  |  **									     **
220  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/31					     **
221  |  **									     **
222  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
223  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
224  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
225  |  **									     **
226  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
227  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
228  |  **									     **
229  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
230  |  **									     **
231  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
232  |  ++++*/
233  | 
234  | int ModuleCmd_Apropos(
235  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
236  | 	int argc,
237  | 	char *argv[]
238  | ) {
239  | 	char          **dirname,	/** modulepath dir		     **/
240  | 	               *c;
241  | 	uvec           *modpath;	/** MODULEPATH vector list           **/
242  | 	int             i;
243  |     /**
244  |      **	 Ignore case ... convert all arguments to lower case
245  |      **/
246  | 	if (sw_icase)
247  | 		for (i = 0; i < argc; i++)
248  | 			for (c = argv[i]; c && *c; c++)
249  | 				*c = tolower(*c);
250  | 
251  | 	/**
252  | 	 **  Load the MODULEPATH and split it into a list of paths.
253  | 	 **  Assume success if no list is to be displayed ...
254  | 	 **/
255  | 	if (!(modpath = ModulePathList()))
256  | 		goto unwind0;
257  | 	if (!uvec_number(modpath))
258  | 		goto success0;
259  | 
260  | 	dirname = uvec_vector(modpath);
261  | 	while (dirname && *dirname) {
262  | 		if (!check_dir(*dirname))
263  | 			continue;
264  | 
265  | 		whatis_dir(*dirname++, argc, argv, WHATIS_SOME);
266  | 	}
267  | 
268  |     /**
269  |      **	 Free up what has been allocated and exit from this procedure
270  |      **/
271  | 	FreeList(&modpath);
272  | 
273  | success0:
274  | 	return (TCL_OK);
275  | 
276  | unwind0:
277  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);			/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
278  | 
279  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Apropos' **/
280  | 
281  | /*++++
282  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
283  |  **									     **
284  |  **   Function:		whatis_dir					     **
285  |  **									     **
286  |  **   Description:	Print all files beyond the passed directory	     **
287  |  **									     **
288  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
289  |  **									     **
290  |  **   Parameters:	char	*dir		Directory to be scanned	     **
291  |  **			int	 argc		Number of tokens	     **
292  |  **			char   **argv		List of tokens to check	     **
293  |  **									     **
294  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
295  |  **									     **
296  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
297  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
298  |  **					control everything		     **
299  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
300  |  **						by the current command	     **
301  |  **									     **
302  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
303  |  ++++*/
304  | 
305  | static	int	whatis_dir( char *dir, int argc, char **argv,
306  | 			    int whatis_list)
307  | {
308  |     fi_ent	 *dirlst_head = NULL;	/** Directory list base pointer	     **/
309  |     int		  count = 0;		/** Number of elements in the top    **/
310  | 					/** level directory list	     **/
311  |     int		  tcount = 0;		/** Total number of files to print   **/
312  |     char	**list;			/** flat list of module files	     **/
313  |     int		  start = 0, i, k;
314  |     int		  result = TCL_OK;
315  |     Tcl_Interp	 *whatis_interp;
316  |     Tcl_DString	  cmdbuf;
317  |     char	  modulefile[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
318  |     char	**wptr, *c;
319  |     struct stat	 stats;
320  | 
321  |     /**
322  |      **	 Normal reading of the files
323  |      **/
324  | 
325  |     if( NULL == (dirlst_head = get_dir( dir, NULL, &count, &tcount)))
326  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_READDIR, LOC, dir, NULL))
327  | 	    goto unwind0;
328  | 
329  |     if( NULL == (list = (char**) module_malloc( tcount * sizeof( char**))))
330  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
331  | 	    goto unwind1;
332  | 
333  |     dirlst_to_list( list, dirlst_head, count, &start, NULL, NULL);
334  | 
335  |     /**
336  |      **	 Initialize the command buffer and set up the modules flag to 'whatislay
337  |      **	 only'
338  |      **/
339  | 
340  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
341  |     g_flags |= M_WHATIS;
342  | 
343  |     /**
344  |      **	 Check all the files in the flat list for the passed tokens
345  |      **/
346  | 
347  |     for( i=0; i<tcount; i++) {
348  | 
349  | 	whatis_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
350  | 	if( TCL_OK != (result = Module_Init( whatis_interp))) {
351  | 	    Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
352  | 	    result = TCL_ERROR;
353  | 	    break; /** for( i) **/
354  | 	}
355  | 
356  | 	/**
357  | 	 **  locate the filename related to the passed module
358  | 	 **/
359  | 
360  | 	if( (char *) NULL == stringer(modulefile,MOD_BUFSIZE,
361  | 		dir,"/",list[i],NULL)) {
362  | 	    result = TCL_ERROR;
363  | 	    break; /** for( i) **/
364  | 	}
365  | 	g_current_module = list[ i];
366  | 
367  | 	if( stat( modulefile, &stats) || S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode))
368  | 	    continue;
369  | 
370  | 	cmdModuleWhatisInit();
371  | 	result = CallModuleProcedure( whatis_interp, &cmdbuf, modulefile,
372  | 	    "ModulesApropos", 0);
373  | 
374  | 	/**
375  | 	 **  Check if at least one of the passed tokens is found in the
376  | 	 **  retrieved whatis strings. If yes, print the string.
377  | 	 **/
378  | 
379  | 	if( whatis) {
380  | 	    wptr = whatis;
381  | 	    while( *wptr) {
382  | 
383  | 		/**
384  | 		 **  Ignore case?
385  | 		 **/
386  | 
387  | 		if( sw_icase) {
388  | 		    strncpy( modulefile, *wptr, MOD_BUFSIZE);
389  | 		    for( c = modulefile; c && *c; c++)
390  | 			*c = tolower( *c);
391  | 		    c = modulefile;
392  | 		} else
393  | 		    c = *wptr;
394  | 
395  | 		/**
396  | 		 **  Seek for the passed tokens
397  | 		 **/
398  | 
399  | 		if( whatis_list)
400  | 		    fprintf( stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", list[i], *wptr);
401  | 		else
402  | 		    for( k=0; k<argc; k++) {
403  | 			if( strstr( c, argv[ k]))
404  | 		    	    fprintf( stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", list[i], *wptr);
405  | 		    }
406  | 		wptr++;
407  | 	    }
408  | 	}
409  | 
410  | 	/**
411  | 	 **  Remove the Tcl interpreter that has been used for printing ...
412  | 	 **/
413  | 
414  | 	Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
415  | 	cmdModuleWhatisShut();
416  | 
417  |     } /** for( i) **/
418  | 
419  |     /**
420  |      **	 Cleanup
421  |      **/
422  |     g_flags &= ~M_WHATIS;
423  |     delete_dirlst( dirlst_head, count);
424  |     delete_cache_list( list, start);
425  | 
426  |     return( result);			/** ------- EXIT (result) --------> **/
427  | 
428  | /* unwind2:
429  |     delete_cache_list( list, start); */
430  | unwind1:
431  |     delete_dirlst( dirlst_head, count);
432  | unwind0:
433  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
434  | 
435  | } /** End of 'whatis_dir' **/
